verses.kjv: And Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem unto his mother’s brethren, and communed with them, and with all the family of the house of his mother’s father, saying,
verses.web: Abimelech the son of Jerubbaal went to Shechem to his mother’s brothers, and spoke with them and with all the family of the house of his mother’s father, saying,
verses.ct: Abimelech, the son of Jerubbaal, traveled to Shechem to visit his mother's brothers. He spoke with them and with his mother's entire extended family, saying,

verses.kjv: Speak, I pray you, in the ears of all the men of Shechem, Whether is better for you, either that all the sons of Jerubbaal, which are threescore and ten persons, reign over you, or that one reign over you? remember also that I am your bone and your flesh.
verses.web: “Please speak in the ears of all the men of Shechem, ‘Is it better for you that all the sons of Jerubbaal, who are seventy persons, rule over you, or that one rule over you?’ Remember also that I am your bone and your flesh.”
verses.ct: "Go to all the leaders of Shechem and ask them this: 'What's better for you — having all 70 of Jerubbaal's sons rule over you, or having just one man rule?' And remind them that I'm one of your own — your own flesh and blood."

verses.kjv: And his mother’s brethren spake of him in the ears of all the men of Shechem all these words: and their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech; for they said, He is our brother.
verses.web: His mother’s brothers spoke of him in the ears of all the men of Shechem all these words. Their hearts inclined to follow Abimelech; for they said, “He is our brother.”
verses.ct: His mother's brothers repeated all of this to the leaders of Shechem, and the people were persuaded to support Abimelech. "After all," they said, "he's one of us."

verses.kjv: And they gave him threescore and ten pieces of silver out of the house of Baalberith, wherewith Abimelech hired vain and light persons, which followed him.
verses.web: They gave him seventy pieces of silver out of the house of Baal Berith, with which Abimelech hired vain and reckless fellows who followed him.
verses.ct: They gave him 70 pieces of silver from the temple of Baal Berith, and Abimelech used the money to hire a gang of reckless, worthless men who became his followers.

verses.kjv: And he went unto his father’s house at Ophrah, and slew his brethren the sons of Jerubbaal, being threescore and ten persons, upon one stone: notwithstanding yet Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left; for he hid himself.
verses.web: He went to his father’s house at Ophrah, and killed his brothers the sons of Jerubbaal, being seventy persons, on one stone; but Jotham the youngest son of Jerubbaal was left, for he hid himself.
verses.ct: He went to his father's home in Ophrah and murdered his brothers — all 70 of Jerubbaal's sons — executing them on a single stone. But Jotham, the youngest son, survived because he had hidden himself.

verses.kjv: And all the men of Shechem gathered together, and all the house of Millo, and went, and made Abimelech king, by the plain of the pillar that was in Shechem.
verses.web: All the men of Shechem assembled themselves together with all the house of Millo, and went and made Abimelech king by the oak of the pillar that was in Shechem.
verses.ct: Then all the leaders of Shechem and the people of Beth Millo gathered together and crowned Abimelech king beside the oak pillar at Shechem.

verses.kjv: And when they told it to Jotham, he went and stood in the top of mount Gerizim, and lifted up his voice, and cried, and said unto them, Hearken unto me, ye men of Shechem, that God may hearken unto you.
verses.web: When they told it to Jotham, he went and stood on the top of Mount Gerizim and lifted up his voice, cried out, and said to them, “Listen to me, you men of Shechem, that God may listen to you.
verses.ct: When Jotham heard about this, he climbed to the top of Mount Gerizim and shouted down to them, "Listen to me, men of Shechem, so that God may listen to you!

verses.kjv: The trees went forth on a time to anoint a king over them; and they said unto the olive tree, Reign thou over us.
verses.web: The trees set out to anoint a king over themselves. They said to the olive tree, ‘Reign over us.’
verses.ct: One day the trees decided to anoint a king over themselves. They went to the olive tree and said, 'Rule over us.'

verses.kjv: But the olive tree said unto them, Should I leave my fatness, wherewith by me they honour God and man, and go to be promoted over the trees?
verses.web: “But the olive tree said to them, ‘Should I stop producing my oil, with which they honor God and man by me, and go to wave back and forth over the trees?’
verses.ct: But the olive tree replied, 'Should I give up my rich oil, which is used to honor God and people, just to sway over the other trees?'

verses.kjv: And the trees said to the fig tree, Come thou, and reign over us.
verses.web: “The trees said to the fig tree, ‘Come and reign over us.’
verses.ct: So the trees went to the fig tree and said, 'Come and rule over us.'

verses.kjv: But the fig tree said unto them, Should I forsake my sweetness, and my good fruit, and go to be promoted over the trees?
verses.web: “But the fig tree said to them, ‘Should I leave my sweetness, and my good fruit, and go to wave back and forth over the trees?’
verses.ct: But the fig tree replied, 'Should I give up my sweetness and my delicious fruit just to sway over the other trees?'

verses.kjv: Then said the trees unto the vine, Come thou, and reign over us.
verses.web: “The trees said to the vine, ‘Come and reign over us.’
verses.ct: Then the trees went to the grapevine and said, 'Come and rule over us.'

verses.kjv: And the vine said unto them, Should I leave my wine, which cheereth God and man, and go to be promoted over the trees?
verses.web: “The vine said to them, ‘Should I leave my new wine, which cheers God and man, and go to wave back and forth over the trees?’
verses.ct: But the grapevine replied, 'Should I give up my wine, which brings joy to God and people, just to sway over the other trees?'

verses.kjv: Then said all the trees unto the bramble, Come thou, and reign over us.
verses.web: “Then all the trees said to the bramble, ‘Come and reign over us.’
verses.ct: Finally, all the trees went to the thornbush and said, 'Come and rule over us.'

verses.kjv: And the bramble said unto the trees, If in truth ye anoint me king over you, then come and put your trust in my shadow: and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.
verses.web: “The bramble said to the trees, ‘If in truth you anoint me king over you, then come and take refuge in my shade; and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.’
verses.ct: The thornbush replied, 'If you truly want to anoint me as your king, then come and take shelter in my shade. But if not, let fire blaze out of this thornbush and burn down even the cedars of Lebanon!'

verses.kjv: Now therefore, if ye have done truly and sincerely, in that ye have made Abimelech king, and if ye have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house, and have done unto him according to the deserving of his hands;
verses.web: “Now therefore, if you have dealt truly and righteously, in that you have made Abimelech king, and if you have dealt well with Jerubbaal and his house, and have done to him according to the deserving of his hands
verses.ct: Now then — did you act with honesty and integrity when you made Abimelech king? Have you treated Jerubbaal and his family fairly? Have you given him what he deserved?

verses.kjv: (For my father fought for you, and adventured his life far, and delivered you out of the hand of Midian:
verses.web: (for my father fought for you, risked his life, and delivered you out of the hand of Midian;
verses.ct: Remember, my father fought for you. He risked his life and rescued you from the Midianites.

verses.kjv: And ye are risen up against my father’s house this day, and have slain his sons, threescore and ten persons, upon one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his maidservant, king over the men of Shechem, because he is your brother;)
verses.web: and you have risen up against my father’s house today and have slain his sons, seventy persons, on one stone, and have made Abimelech, the son of his female servant, king over the men of Shechem, because he is your brother);
verses.ct: But today you've turned on my father's family. You slaughtered his 70 sons on a single stone and made Abimelech — the son of his slave woman — king over Shechem, just because he's your relative.

verses.kjv: If ye then have dealt truly and sincerely with Jerubbaal and with his house this day, then rejoice ye in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you:
verses.web: if you then have dealt truly and righteously with Jerubbaal and with his house today, then rejoice in Abimelech, and let him also rejoice in you;
verses.ct: So if you've acted with honesty and integrity toward Jerubbaal and his family today, then enjoy Abimelech, and may he enjoy you!

verses.kjv: But if not, let fire come out from Abimelech, and devour the men of Shechem, and the house of Millo; and let fire come out from the men of Shechem, and from the house of Millo, and devour Abimelech.
verses.web: but if not, let fire come out from Abimelech and devour the men of Shechem and the house of Millo; and let fire come out from the men of Shechem and from the house of Millo and devour Abimelech.”
verses.ct: But if not, may fire come from Abimelech and consume the men of Shechem and Beth Millo! And may fire come from the men of Shechem and Beth Millo and consume Abimelech!"

verses.kjv: And Jotham ran away, and fled, and went to Beer, and dwelt there, for fear of Abimelech his brother.
verses.web: Jotham ran away and fled, and went to Beer and lived there, for fear of Abimelech his brother.
verses.ct: Then Jotham fled and escaped to Beer, where he settled down because he was afraid of his brother Abimelech.

verses.kjv: When Abimelech had reigned three years over Israel,
verses.web: Abimelech was prince over Israel three years.
verses.ct: Abimelech ruled over Israel for 3 years.

verses.kjv: Then God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the men of Shechem; and the men of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech:
verses.web: Then God sent an evil spirit between Abimelech and the men of Shechem; and the men of Shechem dealt treacherously with Abimelech,
verses.ct: Then God sent an evil spirit to stir up hostility between Abimelech and the leaders of Shechem, and the men of Shechem turned against Abimelech.

verses.kjv: That the cruelty done to the threescore and ten sons of Jerubbaal might come, and their blood be laid upon Abimelech their brother, which slew them; and upon the men of Shechem, which aided him in the killing of his brethren.
verses.web: that the violence done to the seventy sons of Jerubbaal might come, and that their blood might be laid on Abimelech their brother who killed them, and on the men of Shechem who strengthened his hands to kill his brothers.
verses.ct: This happened so that the violent murder of Jerubbaal's 70 sons would be avenged — their blood falling on Abimelech, who killed them, and on the men of Shechem, who helped him do it.

verses.kjv: And the men of Shechem set liers in wait for him in the top of the mountains, and they robbed all that came along that way by them: and it was told Abimelech.
verses.web: The men of Shechem set an ambush for him on the tops of the mountains, and they robbed all who came along that way by them; and Abimelech was told about it.
verses.ct: The men of Shechem posted ambushes for him on the hilltops and robbed everyone who traveled past on the roads. Word of this reached Abimelech.

verses.kjv: And Gaal the son of Ebed came with his brethren, and went over to Shechem: and the men of Shechem put their confidence in him.
verses.web: Gaal the son of Ebed came with his brothers and went over to Shechem; and the men of Shechem put their trust in him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, a man named Gaal son of Ebed moved to Shechem with his brothers, and the leaders of Shechem put their trust in him.

verses.kjv: And they went out into the fields, and gathered their vineyards, and trode the grapes, and made merry, and went into the house of their god, and did eat and drink, and cursed Abimelech.
verses.web: They went out into the field, harvested their vineyards, trod the grapes, celebrated, and went into the house of their god and ate and drank, and cursed Abimelech.
verses.ct: They went out into the fields, harvested their grapes, stomped them into wine, and threw a festival. Then they went into the temple of their god, where they ate and drank and hurled insults at Abimelech.

verses.kjv: And Gaal the son of Ebed said, Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve him? is not he the son of Jerubbaal? and Zebul his officer? serve the men of Hamor the father of Shechem: for why should we serve him?
verses.web: Gaal the son of Ebed said, “Who is Abimelech, and who is Shechem, that we should serve him? Isn’t he the son of Jerubbaal? Isn’t Zebul his officer? Serve the men of Hamor the father of Shechem, but why should we serve him?
verses.ct: Gaal son of Ebed said, "Who does Abimelech think he is? And why should Shechem serve him? Isn't he just the son of Jerubbaal, with Zebul as his puppet governor? Serve the descendants of Hamor, the founder of Shechem — but why should we serve Abimelech?

verses.kjv: And would to God this people were under my hand! then would I remove Abimelech. And he said to Abimelech, Increase thine army, and come out.
verses.web: I wish that this people were under my hand! Then I would remove Abimelech.” He said to Abimelech, “Increase your army and come out!”
verses.ct: If only these people were under my command! I'd get rid of Abimelech in no time." Then he taunted Abimelech, saying, "Build up your army and come fight me!"

verses.kjv: And when Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed, his anger was kindled.
verses.web: When Zebul the ruler of the city heard the words of Gaal the son of Ebed, his anger burned.
verses.ct: When Zebul, the governor of the city, heard what Gaal son of Ebed had said, he was furious.

verses.kjv: And he sent messengers unto Abimelech privily, saying, Behold, Gaal the son of Ebed and his brethren be come to Shechem; and, behold, they fortify the city against thee.
verses.web: He sent messengers to Abimelech craftily, saying, “Behold, Gaal the son of Ebed and his brothers have come to Shechem; and behold, they incite the city against you.
verses.ct: He secretly sent messengers to Abimelech, warning him, "Gaal son of Ebed and his brothers have come to Shechem, and they're turning the whole city against you.

verses.kjv: Now therefore up by night, thou and the people that is with thee, and lie in wait in the field:
verses.web: Now therefore, go up by night, you and the people who are with you, and lie in wait in the field.
verses.ct: Move out tonight with your forces and set up an ambush in the fields.

verses.kjv: And it shall be, that in the morning, as soon as the sun is up, thou shalt rise early, and set upon the city: and, behold, when he and the people that is with him come out against thee, then mayest thou do to them as thou shalt find occasion.
verses.web: It shall be that in the morning, as soon as the sun is up, you shall rise early and rush on the city. Behold, when he and the people who are with him come out against you, then may you do to them as you shall find occasion.”
verses.ct: Then at dawn, as soon as the sun comes up, charge the city. When Gaal and his men come out to fight you, do whatever you can to them."

verses.kjv: And Abimelech rose up, and all the people that were with him, by night, and they laid wait against Shechem in four companies.
verses.web: Abimelech rose up, and all the people who were with him, by night, and they laid wait against Shechem in four companies.
verses.ct: So Abimelech and all his men moved out during the night and set up an ambush around Shechem in 4 groups.

verses.kjv: And Gaal the son of Ebed went out, and stood in the entering of the gate of the city: and Abimelech rose up, and the people that were with him, from lying in wait.
verses.web: Gaal the son of Ebed went out, and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city. Abimelech rose up, and the people who were with him, from the ambush.
verses.ct: When Gaal son of Ebed came out and stood at the entrance of the city gate, Abimelech and his men rose from their hiding places.

verses.kjv: And when Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, Behold, there come people down from the top of the mountains. And Zebul said unto him, Thou seest the shadow of the mountains as if they were men.
verses.web: When Gaal saw the people, he said to Zebul, “Behold, people are coming down from the tops of the mountains.” Zebul said to him, “You see the shadows of the mountains as if they were men.”
verses.ct: Gaal spotted the troops and said to Zebul, "Look — people are coming down from the hilltops!" But Zebul replied, "You're just seeing the shadows of the mountains. They look like men."

verses.kjv: And Gaal spake again and said, See there come people down by the middle of the land, and another company come along by the plain of Meonenim.
verses.web: Gaal spoke again and said, “Behold, people are coming down by the middle of the land, and one company comes by the way of the oak of Meonenim.”
verses.ct: Gaal spoke up again: "No, look! People are coming down from the center of the land, and another group is approaching from the direction of the Diviners' Oak."

verses.kjv: Then said Zebul unto him, Where is now thy mouth, wherewith thou saidst, Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him? is not this the people that thou hast despised? go out, I pray now, and fight with them.
verses.web: Then Zebul said to him, “Now where is your mouth, that you said, ‘Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him?’ Isn’t this the people that you have despised? Please go out now and fight with them.”
verses.ct: Zebul turned on him and said, "Where's all that big talk now? You're the one who said, 'Who is Abimelech that we should serve him?' These are the very people you mocked. Go out and fight them!"

verses.kjv: And Gaal went out before the men of Shechem, and fought with Abimelech.
verses.web: Gaal went out before the men of Shechem, and fought with Abimelech.
verses.ct: So Gaal led the men of Shechem out to battle against Abimelech.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him, and many were overthrown and wounded, even unto the entering of the gate.
verses.web: Abimelech chased him, and he fled before him, and many fell wounded, even to the entrance of the gate.
verses.ct: But Abimelech chased him, and Gaal fled. Many of his men fell wounded all the way back to the city gate.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech dwelt at Arumah: and Zebul thrust out Gaal and his brethren, that they should not dwell in Shechem.
verses.web: Abimelech lived at Arumah; and Zebul drove out Gaal and his brothers, that they should not dwell in Shechem.
verses.ct: Abimelech then stationed himself at Arumah, and Zebul drove Gaal and his brothers out of Shechem so they could no longer live there.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the morrow, that the people went out into the field; and they told Abimelech.
verses.web: On the next day, the people went out into the field; and they told Abimelech.
verses.ct: The next day, the people of Shechem went out into the fields, and someone reported this to Abimelech.

verses.kjv: And he took the people, and divided them into three companies, and laid wait in the field, and looked, and, behold, the people were come forth out of the city; and he rose up against them, and smote them.
verses.web: He took the people and divided them into three companies, and laid wait in the field; and he looked, and behold, the people came out of the city. So, he rose up against them and struck them.
verses.ct: He divided his forces into 3 groups and set an ambush in the fields. When he saw the people coming out of the city, he attacked them.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech, and the company that was with him, rushed forward, and stood in the entering of the gate of the city: and the two other companies ran upon all the people that were in the fields, and slew them.
verses.web: Abimelech and the companies that were with him rushed forward and stood in the entrance of the gate of the city; and the two companies rushed on all who were in the field and struck them.
verses.ct: Abimelech and his group rushed forward and seized the city gate, while the other 2 groups charged everyone out in the fields and cut them down.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech fought against the city all that day; and he took the city, and slew the people that was therein, and beat down the city, and sowed it with salt.
verses.web: Abimelech fought against the city all that day; and he took the city and killed the people in it. He beat down the city and sowed it with salt.
verses.ct: Abimelech fought against the city all day long. He captured it, killed everyone inside, tore the city down to the ground, and scattered salt over the ruins.

verses.kjv: And when all the men of the tower of Shechem heard that, they entered into an hold of the house of the god Berith.
verses.web: When all the men of the tower of Shechem heard of it, they entered into the stronghold of the house of Elberith.
verses.ct: When the people in the tower of Shechem heard what had happened, they took refuge in the stronghold of the temple of El Berith.

verses.kjv: And it was told Abimelech, that all the men of the tower of Shechem were gathered together.
verses.web: Abimelech was told that all the men of the tower of Shechem were gathered together.
verses.ct: Abimelech was told that everyone from the tower of Shechem had gathered there.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech gat him up to mount Zalmon, he and all the people that were with him; and Abimelech took an axe in his hand, and cut down a bough from the trees, and took it, and laid it on his shoulder, and said unto the people that were with him, What ye have seen me do, make haste, and do as I have done.
verses.web: Abimelech went up to Mount Zalmon, he and all the people who were with him; and Abimelech took an ax in his hand, and cut down a bough from the trees, and took it up, and laid it on his shoulder. Then he said to the people who were with him, “What you have seen me do, make haste, and do as I have done!”
verses.ct: He led all his men up Mount Zalmon, grabbed an ax, and chopped off a tree branch. He hoisted it onto his shoulder and told his men, "You saw what I just did — hurry and do the same thing!"

verses.kjv: And all the people likewise cut down every man his bough, and followed Abimelech, and put them to the hold, and set the hold on fire upon them; so that all the men of the tower of Shechem died also, about a thousand men and women.
verses.web: All the people likewise each cut down his bough, followed Abimelech, and put them at the base of the stronghold, and set the stronghold on fire over them, so that all the people of the tower of Shechem died also, about a thousand men and women.
verses.ct: So each man cut a branch and followed Abimelech. They piled the branches against the stronghold and set it on fire with the people still inside. Everyone in the tower of Shechem died that day — about 1,000 men and women.

verses.kjv: Then went Abimelech to Thebez, and encamped against Thebez, and took it.
verses.web: Then Abimelech went to Thebez and encamped against Thebez, and took it.
verses.ct: From there, Abimelech marched to Thebez, besieged it, and captured it.

verses.kjv: But there was a strong tower within the city, and thither fled all the men and women, and all they of the city, and shut it to them, and gat them up to the top of the tower.
verses.web: But there was a strong tower within the city, and all the men and women of the city fled there, and shut themselves in, and went up to the roof of the tower.
verses.ct: But there was a fortified tower inside the city, and all the men and women — everyone in the city — fled into it, locked the door behind them, and climbed up to the roof.

verses.kjv: And Abimelech came unto the tower, and fought against it, and went hard unto the door of the tower to burn it with fire.
verses.web: Abimelech came to the tower and fought against it, and came near to the door of the tower to burn it with fire.
verses.ct: Abimelech advanced on the tower and attacked it. He went right up to the entrance, intending to set it on fire.

verses.kjv: And a certain woman cast a piece of a millstone upon Abimelech’s head, and all to brake his skull.
verses.web: A certain woman cast an upper millstone on Abimelech’s head, and broke his skull.
verses.ct: But a woman dropped an upper millstone on Abimelech's head and cracked his skull.

verses.kjv: Then he called hastily unto the young man his armourbearer, and said unto him, Draw thy sword, and slay me, that men say not of me, A woman slew him. And his young man thrust him through, and he died.
verses.web: Then he called hastily to the young man, his armor bearer, and said to him, “Draw your sword and kill me, that men not say of me, ‘A woman killed him.’ His young man thrust him through, and he died.”
verses.ct: He quickly called to the young man who carried his armor and said, "Draw your sword and kill me, so no one can say a woman killed me." So the young man ran him through, and he died.

verses.kjv: And when the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, they departed every man unto his place.
verses.web: When the men of Israel saw that Abimelech was dead, they each departed to his place.
verses.ct: When the Israelites saw that Abimelech was dead, they all went home.

verses.kjv: Thus God rendered the wickedness of Abimelech, which he did unto his father, in slaying his seventy brethren:
verses.web: Thus God repaid the wickedness of Abimelech, which he did to his father in killing his seventy brothers;
verses.ct: In this way, God repaid Abimelech for the evil he had done to his father by murdering his 70 brothers.

verses.kjv: And all the evil of the men of Shechem did God render upon their heads: and upon them came the curse of Jotham the son of Jerubbaal.
verses.web: and God repaid all the wickedness of the men of Shechem on their heads; and the curse of Jotham the son of Jerubbaal came on them.
verses.ct: God also brought down on the men of Shechem all the evil they had done, and the curse that Jotham son of Jerubbaal had spoken came true against them.
